title: Language Education Curriculum Design Utilizing Interactive Learning Space Classroom Effects

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and understanding of job-related terminology
context.additional_context: Participants are office/administrative professionals requiring improvement in practical language application skills, with learning outcomes measured through project-based assessment. Technology environment applies the bring-your-own-device (BYOD) approach

learning_goals: Learners can improve language communication skills by 20% through activity-based learning in an interactive learning space classroom.
Learners can achieve over 90% completion of team projects using digital collaboration tools (Zoom breakout rooms, real-time document editing, etc.).
Learners can measure a 15% improvement in language learning efficiency (achievement per time invested) through pre-/post-assessment comparisons.

resources: Real-time collaborative editing tools (Google Docs, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
